授業目的: After studying the history of postwar Japanese diplomacy and the challenges facing Japanese foreign policy, students will gain an understanding of how foreign policy is determined. The course aims to help students understand the theory of foreign policy in international politics and then to help them examine foreign policy in real life.
到達目標:
Understand the basic concepts of Japanese diplomacy
To be able to explain contemporary issues of Japanese diplomacy in one's own words
授業方法:
Course Format:Combination of lectures and discussion.
This class conducted by interactive.
For this class, students are required to read reference books and downloadmaterials: PowerPoint slide.

第2回: Postwar Japan Diplomacy①　From Occupation to　Independence
第3回: Postwar Japan Diplomacy②  The Conditions of an Independent State: Japanese Diplomacy in the 1950s
第4回: Postwar Japan Diplomacy③ The Model of an Economic Power: Japanese Diplomacy in the 1960s
第5回: Postwar Japan Diplomacy④ Legacy of Asia Pacific War: Okinawa and Japan-China relations normalization
第6回: Postwar Japan Diplomacy⑤ International State: Japanese Diplomacy 1980s
第7回: Postwar Japan Diplomacy⑥ Post Cold War and Security Crisis in East Asia
第8回: Postwar Japan Diplomacy⑦ From War on Terror and US-China Confrontation
第9回: Issue of Japanese Foreign Policy①　Territorial Dispute
第10回: Issue of Japanese Foreign Policy②　Human Security and United Nation
第11回: Issue of Japanese Foreign Policy③　National Security Policy
第12回: Issue of Japanese Foreign Policy④　TPP
第13回: Issue of Japanese Foreign Policy⑤　FOIP and Japan and Indo-Pacific Nations
